values: Listen up! My friends band, Bullet Train to Vegas, needs to get first place in this contest. Why? No particular reason aside the fact that I think it's about time that Greg (my friend) got what was coming to him with his band. He's been putting the time in for years and years, and I really thing he has a chance to "make it" with this band, and I want to help him with that as much as I possibly can. Click this link once per day to vote for Bullet Train to Vegas. http://www.punkradiocast.com/TOP10.php?vote=2138

Remember when I said I was going to update every day for a month?  I think that lasted two weeks.  I know, I suck.

I'm not making any promises as to when I'll be udating in the future, but I can guaran-damn-tee that if i don't get at least 5 comments from 5 different people about how I should update more - i'll never ever update again.

Friends, get on it!  Inspire me!  Tell me how much you miss me!  Stroke my penis.  Er, I mean my ego.

Also, today I used a word w/ two apostrophies:

y'all'd

I bring teh rox.

Got a wild hair up my ass and decided to burn 20 CD's tonight, bringing my total to a whopping 123 albums.  I now have 77 albums to go before it's time to buy a bigger CD binder.

It took me about 2 hours to burn, reorganize (because I'm anal about alphabetizing) and list all of my albums.  I think that tomorrow I'll set up an actual database so I don't have to retype this every single time I add albums to my collection.

If I'm missing something that you think I HAVE to get, let me know - I'll get it.

So I was browsing Drew Curtis' Fark.com and came across this article about prostitution. After reading it, I kind of entered into massive thought mode, and started pondering the following... First, when I say prostitution, I mean consensual sex between an adult jane? and john, not any kind of forced sex, or sex resulting from personal threats, or prostitution by a minor (under 18 years of age) Why is prostitution in it's purest form illegal? If a man or woman wants to sell his or her body, how is it civilly acceptable for you or I to tell them that they can't? Is the risk of spreading STD's more inherent for a prostitute than it is for you or I? Does sheer number of partners necessarily preclude one's ability to stay STD free? If someone is prostituting themselves, even as a last resort to pay the bills, does that make it non-consensual sex? Even under those circumstances, the act of taking money from someone indicates consent to have sex. How is prostitution different from the porn industry. Are not both male and female actors paid to have sex on camera? Is the camera the only aspect that turns being compensated monetarily for sex from prostitution into pornography? Finally, how is the act of taking someone out to dinner with the hopes of getting laid not prostitution? If the direct result of the money spent on dinner is the buying party getting laid, I don't see how it differs all that much. If you've read this far, please comment :)

So Rockstar now comes in a 24oz version.

I think I'm in love.

So two nights ago I must have been playing w/ my tongue ring in my sleep and ripped it accidentally, cause my tongue has been hurting like fucking crazy.

I've been rinsing with saltwater all freeking day, hopefully that'll make it stop hurting.

I just took the damn ring out too, took two pairs of plyers, lol.

It feels really strange.
FROM MY NEW MONITOR! It's fucking sweet. So much more crisp than my last monitor. YAAAAAY! And, without further ado, here it is: and more pictars: Click!

MY MONITOR!

20.1 INCHES OF DELL FLATSCREEN FUCKING GOODNESS.  IT'LL BE HERE NEXT FREEKING WEEK!

I know I've neglected my LJ these past few weeks, but meh, that's how it goes.

I'll try to get better again.

So, we called UGG yesterday morning to see what was up w/ our remaining orders, because we had been told they were closed - which generally means shipped.

Well, they hadn't been shipped, they had been canceled.

So we called our rep, pissed, but he had found out before us, and he was even more pissed, cause he KNEW we woudl have taken it out of his hide if they seriously fucked us like that.

So he says he's working on it, and gets us in touch with someone WAY up in the company - the president teh credit manager - they were all involved.

Anyway, they called us up and said give us a list of everything you've presold, and we'll see what we can do.  We gave them a list of 895 pair that we needed.

Three hours later, they called back and said, we have good news, and bad news.

The bad news is, the 4 pair of Classic Short Ruby Boots in size 5 aren't going to be available.

Meaning, we have 891 Pairs of boots coming in, and we're not fucked for the rest of the year.

YAY deckers for fucking up and having to crawl all over themselves to keep us from being fucked.

I was having a BITCH of a time removing that stupid virus from my system.  Then I realized that I might not be the only one in fected, so I check my system shares, and sure enough, krystals computer is connecting to my computer for no reason.

After I disconnected her from the network and cleaned my system for the THIRD time tonight, the virus is gone and has not come back.

I don't know who got it and gave it to who, but based on the fact that her computer was connecting to mine, I'm going to say that she got it and gave it to me.

Damnit.

Synopsis:
1AM - Get annoying windows file protection popup telling me to insert win 2k cd to replace protected files that have been modified. move popup to corner of screen to deal with later when I have my 2k cd.

5AM - Go to sleep. Prepare computer for sleep mode as always, ctrl+alt+del to lock, turn off monitor.

12PM - Wake up, turn on monitor and shake mouse to wake computer from sleep mode. Nothing. Press keys. Nothing. Restart. Nothing. Give up and clean car.

4PM - Kick computer, restart, nothing. Give up and clean room.

10PM - Boot into safe mode, run Trendmicro's Housecall, and their sysclean package. Removes 500 or so instances of PE_PARITE.A. Restart. Nothing.

Restart into safe mode again, run SpyBot Search & Destroy. Nothing. Reboot into VGA mode. Works. Change resolution from 1600x1200 to 1280x1024. Restart. Bingo.

Change resolution back to 1600x1200 Sit for 15 seconds while windows realizes it can't use the display setting I've been using for over a year.

Reboot into safe mode. Uninstall video drivers. Reboot into safe mode. Install video drivers. Reboot. Set resolution to 1600x1200, nothing.

Put in windows2000 CD. Restart. Run recovery options. Restart. Set resolution to 1600x1200. Nothing.

Restart. Install dual boot copy of 2k. Install motherboard drivers. Restart. Install video drivers. Restart. change resolution to 1600x1200. Nothing.

Turn off computer. Make sure RAM is in fact Kingston Ram. It is. Reseat RAM. Boot. Res change. Nothing. Turn off. Reseat ram in slot 2. Start. Res change. Nothing.

I didn't go to work today.  I've been having a REALLY hard time going to sleep and waking up on time - so I took a day off to sort of have to myself and get myself ready for a forced schedule.

I also got my hairs cut and shaved, then took my brother out for lunch.

The new plan is: up at 8, in bed at 11.  This isn't something I'm going to TRY to do, this is something I AM goign to do.

Didn't suck as much as I expected it to, but it wasn't nearly as good as I thought it would be either.

The plot twist at the end was way too predictable, and the cast did seem to just be hanging out - as opposed to really getting into their characters.  To sum it up - it was basically everything the press said it was going to be.

Also had brunch w/ krystal's dad today too - it's getting easier and easier to hang out w/ him - he's less of an Ogre now that he's remarried and happy w/ his life.  We might go shooting sometime soon.  Yay shooting ranges.

I want to watch disc 3 of 24, but I think it'll have to wait till tomorrow.

On another note, how in the hell is there not a mood setting and icon for "comfortable"?  That's lame.

A GRIP of us played LazerTag tonight, well - last night, technically -  at UltraZone - Matt, Sarah, Me, Krystal, David, Sally, Adam, Miller, Bianca, Justine, Greg, and Justines brother, who's name I caught, but can't remember.

I had a lot of fun, but I always do when I head down there, but the best part is that everyone (save Justine and Sally) had a really good time too.  Not that that's surprising, I expected them both to play one game and then be over it.

All in all - it was a good time out w/ friends and some family, and it was great to see Danny again.  There aren't many people I miss from my days at UltraZone - but somehow - even just stopping in to see Danny makes me smile.

I'm way out of shape...  I definatly need to do something.

Yeah.  I seriously hate waking up.  Serves me right for staying up late to watch 24.

I don't want to be at work today, which isn't really too far from normal, it's just more intense cause I'm tired.

Blah.

Had a decent sized argument w/ Krystal tonight about the way I behave if and when I decide to go out.  Based on past experiences, Krystal often has troubles with me going out, even to the most mundane places w/ whom I believe to be very trustworthy people.  It's not that I've ever given her reason to doubt me, and I havn't, but because of a specific instance when a female friend of mine followed me into the bathroom at a party cause she really had to pee - and I got there first.  Nothing happened - nothing ever would have - but it was taken the wrong way and drama ensued.

Anyway - Krystal has had issues w/ me going out in the past - that often, due to her inability to see that it's totally innocent, and my inability to handle her inability to handle - we often fought about me going out.  This ended up in fighting for an hour before I left, and often fighting for an hour on the phone sometime during the night.  Never a fun situation.  This lead me to do one of three things when the opportunity to go out arose - in order of most common to least common.

1) Not go out to avoid a fight.
2) Go out and handle the fight, which puts a damper on my evening.
3) Go out and not say anything, and hope that it doesn't come out later.

As is quite obvious, none of those situations are ideal, and it's #3 that Krystal took the most issue with, which is completly understandable to me.  I don't ever give her shit about where she's going - but as any reasonable S.O. I like to know where she's going in case of an emergency.  It was very hard for me to extend her that common curtesy however, because I was afraid to deal with the fight beforehand.  Her getting as upset as she does may be a very valid response - but it's not one I understand, and I don't know how to properly relay that, if there is a proper way to relay that I don't understand the way she's feeling - so I just wouldn't say anything.

After about an hour of virtually screaming at each other, and her making me realize that I wasn't giving her a chance, and that she had gotten a lot better about things like that, and I must admit, she has come a very long way - we came to an agreement that hopefully will work out well for both of us.

1) I'm going to tell her where I'm going and what I'm doing - instead of just not going out or keeping her in the dark.
2) She's going to do everything in her power to understand that I'm not doing anything stupid, and to let me go without a fight, because she does trust me.
3) She told me that most times when she gets upset, she realizes later that she overreacted, either to the situation, or to I dealt with her overreacting, which is understandable since I can be a cunt when I don't get my way.  So she told me that if she starts giving me shit about going out because of where or who I'm going with - that I should kiss her goodbye, tell her I love her, and go.

I'm not so sure how #3 is going to work out, but I'm tired of having fights, and I'm tired of not going out for fear of having fights, so I'm willing to give it a shot.  And, if it doesn't work - at least I'm not holding things back from her anymore.

So yeah.  I think this is by far the most personal entry I've posted in my journal.  Hopefully I won't have to keep these to a minimum.

I rediscovered an old favorite of mine today - Campbells Cream of Mushroom Soup.  It's been SO long sinve I've had it, I've forgotten how good and how filling it really is.  It's reasonably cheap too, which means that in these not so financially great times - I can get a case from smart and final and virtually live off of the stuff.

The best part is - I won't care, cause it's so nummy.

:) :) :) :)

I'm sure most everyone that's spent a decent amount of time chatting it up on AIM or MSN/Yahoo for you late bloomers can relate to this vid.

http://letslol.com/blockedme.swf

I love a day when I have nothing to do but sit around and watch TV.  Or play on my computer.  Or go to Matts house and hang out.

The best part of it is - I don't HAVE to do any of it.  I can do what I want, when I want, and no one can tell me otherwise - and it's fucking grand.

Tomorrow we're back at work.  Get the rest of the horrible December sales in, and I find out if I have to look for a second job to afford myself.  Wish me luck.

The Jets virtually handed it to them 3 times, and they still managed to lose in the 4th posession in overtime.  It was mildly depressing for me, since I don't normally care about who wins and loses which game.

I'm only really into it because of my family - and even then only when I'm there watching with them.  I don't get as hyped up as they do, but I do cheer and cuss on good and bad plays respectivly.

I'm sad that they lost, but glad that I got to spend a good chunk of time w/ my family.

It was also my mothers surprise birthday party - it was my responsibility to get her there on time, and I did a great job of that - she had no idear it was coming.  It was a really good time for her too.  She got lots of presents, including a new Sewing machine - something that surprised her so much and made her so happy - she cried.

I'm glad that the day went the way it did.  Lots of fun was had, lots of my Uncle Bob's barbecue ribs were eaten, and all in all, it was a good time.

I wan't a full month where I don't miss any days posting here, and this will be the third consecutive day that I've made a post - so I'm about 1/10th of the way there.

Hopefully I'll have more than just unintelligible babble for you to read - or maybe even :: gasp :: a picture here or there - but more than likely, it'll just be me rambling on about nothing.

Got a problem?  I didn't think so.  On a side note, hardly any of you fuckers comment enough.  I'm tired of seeing other journals where there are a bazillion comments, and then I come to mine and I have 4 comments on 10 entries.  Make me feel special, damn you!
about 7 hours of playing with where the furniture should go, this is what I've come up with:

There is one major problem with the current setup, and a few rather annoying restrictions that are making moving this shit around extremly hard. I'm hoping that someone will be able to reccomend a setup that works, and save me from tearing the rest of my hair out. I've been playing w/ trying to get this damn room arranged for about 4 hours now, and I just can't do it. HELP! Impossible solutions: 1) Get rid of the cats. 2) Take the cabinets down. 3) Seal the garage door. Problem: There is a window at the head of the bed (east wall), and the stupid cats play in said window. When stupid cats lose footing, or decide to play chicken, stupid cats fall w/ claws out on our faces. While we sleep. Additional info about the room: 1) It's hard to see in the image, but on the east wall, there are hanging cabinets that cannot be removed - they start about 4 feet off the floor and continue on to the ceiling. They are above the fridge and both dressers. 2) The two unlabeled tan rectngles on the west wall signify space that is rendered useless due to the garage hinges. Yes, the west wall is a garage door, and it cannot be sealed or made un-openable. 3) In additon to the window on the east wall, there is also a window on the north wall - right smack dab in the middle, and it's as long as the sorter, and half of the couch. Furniture Restrictions: 1) The bed cannot be below a window, under the cabinets (because she doesn't like buggies, even if there aren't really any buggies) or on the west wall (because it's too cold.) 2) The TV has to be on one of the walls, and preferable (though not currently) viewable if you're on the bed, and if you're on the couches - it's only a 13 inch TV. 3) Neither of the computer desks fit under the shelves on the east wall. 4) She would prefer one side of the bed is against a wall, otherwise she feels like she's going to fall off of it.

The new styl wasn't exactly what I wanted and grated on my nerves, so I'm going to use this one for now.

If you are a graphic designer, and can make me a background image that looks like the computer from Minority Report or Paycheck, I'll change my style again.  Till then, this is what you get.

So this new layout is Completly designed by me, from placement to photoshoping.  The only thing, in fact, that I didn't do by hand is the background image.  I'll get to my friends page later, till then, it'll be all fucked up.

LET ME KNOW WHAT YOU THINK, OR I'LL KILL YOU!

I just remembered that I've been having really fucking amazing dreams recently.

The surroundings and people have been different, but one thing in the dreams remains constant:

I have the ability to fly, and to make things hover.  I'm apparently still learning how to do it in dream world, because it doesn't always work exactly like I want it to, and sometimes I have to try a few times to move something.

The first time I had that dream I was in a HUGE warehouse - kind of like a skatepark, and I started trying to move one of those tiny superballs.  AFter I got the basic hang of that, someone taught me how to use my abilities to make myself fly.

Each time that I have the dream, I try moving something bigger, and flying is easier and easier.

I don't know what these dreams mean, but I hope I keep having them because they're really fucking cool.

This whole "voters wrote in the name but didn't fill in the bubble so their ballot isn't going to be counted" thing is really starting to bother me.  If someone took the time to go to the polls, or even to fill out their absentee ballot, and then has their vote disqualified based on a technicality - the democratic system that we believe in so strongly has failed.

If I go into a bank, pull a gun and demand that I be given all the money in the safe, and then get away with nothing, I can be charged with attempted robbery because my INTENTION to rob the bank was clear.  Based on that logic, the ballot of someone who goes to the polls and writes in a candidates name should be counted due to the fact that it was their INTENT to vote for the person whos name was written on the ballot.

I don't live in San Diego, so I don't really care who the mayor is.  I do however, believe that the law should be changed to side with the voter instead of the instructions in the case of "hanging chads" or write in candadites, as long as the intent of the voter can be determined.  I will be extremly upset if the law does not change based on this election, and I will also be very disappointed w/ Dick Murphy if he doesn't at least come forward and admit that he is NOT the person who the majority of people in San Diego county want to be mayor.

As far as I'm concerned, Dick Murphy lost this election based on the fact that there are 5000 write in ballots for Donna Frye that have not been counted in the official election tally and the fact that he only won by a margin of 2000 votes.  The people of San Diego want Donna Frye, and they should have Donna Frye.

Step 1 Make a post (public, friendslocked, filtered...whatever you're comfortable with) to your LJ. The post should contain your list of 10 holiday wishes. The wishes can be anything at all, from simple and fandom-related ("I'd love a Snape/Hermione icon that's just for me") to medium ("I wish for _____ on DVD") to really big ("All I want for Christmas is a new car/computer/house/TV.") The important thing is, make sure these wishes are things you really, truly want. If you wish for real life things (not fics or icons), make sure you include some sort of contact info in your post, whether it's your address or just your email address where Santa (or one of his elves) could get in touch with you. Also, make sure you post some version of these guidelines in your LJ, or link to this post (it'll be public) so that the holiday joy will spread. Step Two Surf around your friends list (or friendsfriends, or just random journals) to see who has posted their list. And now here's the important part: If you see a wish you can grant, and it's in your heart to do so, make someone's wish come true. Sometimes someone's trash is another's treasure, and if you have a leather jacket you don't want or a gift certificate you won't use--or even know where you could get someone's dream purebred Basset Hound for free--do it. You needn't spend money on these wishes unless you want to. The point isn't to put people out, it's to provide everyone a chance to be someone else's holiday elf--to spread the joy. Gifts can be made anonymously or not--it's your call. There are no rules with this project, no guarantees, and no strings attached. Just...wish, and it might come true. Give, and you might receive. And you'll have the joy of knowing you made someone's holiday special. My List 1) Lots of pictures of each of my friends 2) Canon EOS300D Digital Rebel 3) Linksys WAP45G Wireless Access Point 4) Linksys WMP54G Wireless PCI Card (Two of them) 5) Maxed out Dell XPS Notebook Computer 6) Books (Eric Nylund, Chuck Palahniuk, John Grisham etc.) 7) Smilecam Webcam 8) Canon I9900 Photo Printer 9) Dell UltraSharp 2001FP 20.1-inch Flat Panel LCD Monitor 10) Mens low rise jeans, light colors - size 38x30 (short and fat ;P) Do with this list what you wish...

Remember the movie Tron?  Remember the bitchin light cycle game they had to play?  Well here it is folks.  Best damn Tron light cycle game I've ever played.  AND it has fully functional internet multiplayer.

You should all get it, learn it, and then get in touch w/ me so I can beat your ass Tron style :)

Before you call me a complete nerd, which I am of course, you should try the game out, you'll find it to be incredibly addicting, especially now that the internet multiplayer works.

Program Download:
http://prdownloads.sourceforge.net/armagetron/armagetron-windows-0.2.6.0.exe

Installer to make it look more like the movie:
http://armagetron.sourceforge.net/addons/moviepack_install.exe

Movie Sounds Installer:
http://armagetron.sourceforge.net/addons/moviesounds_install.exe

So the radio shack next door got robbed the other day, and this morning we come into work and the manager is outside on her phone w/ the police because her store was broken into again.

Seriously, there are some idiots up here - why on earth would you break into a radio shack?  There isn't all that much there that you can get out through the ceiling into a hole to the vacant building next door.

Oh whelps.  I'm sure they'll figure it out.

Goddamn ringing phones
People can't speak english well
I'm going insane.

Everyone wants Uggs.
Ugg won't give us our shipments.
People don't get Uggs.

Loud banshee banshee
Makes my ear canals bleed red
Where is the damn bus?

I'm getting increasingly tired of having to ask people to repeat themselves because I can't understand them becuase of their accent.

It's getting really old.

I was driving home from 7-11 tonight, and I turned on the radio.

I thought "Oh, Disturbed..  I can deal with that."

So I'm listening to this band and all of a sudden it starts sounding like KoRn.

I listened some more - I can dig a band that sounds like Disturbed and KoRn..

A few seconds later though, I hear something that sounds similar to the the rasta guy that sings w/ Shaggy, but with a hard chunky rock beat.

Disturbed, KoRn, and Shaggy - all rolled into one.  The band was called Skindred, and the song Nobody - If you like Disturbed, KoRn and Shaggy, you should check them out.

So my new slippers ARENT warm.

Damnit.

I got new slippers, I got new slippers, I got new slippers hey hey hey hey...

And they're warm too.

A word for the wise:

When you've had several drinks, don't do the worm.  When you try to get up afterwards, you will land on your ankle funny, hear a pop, and then be in pain for hours.

Yeah, I'm gimpin it up.

Damn alcohol.

I'm planning a poker tournament.  A BIG poker tournament.

As of right now, the date is set at February 5th, a Saturday, and the location is pending.

The game will be Texas Hold'Em.
There will be 10 players.
The buy-in will be $500.
This tournament will be invite only.

After three rounds of tournament play, a single winner will walk away with $4000.

I'm hoping that of the 25 or so invitations I send out, I'll be able to find 10 people willing to take the risk.

I figure that 2 months planning time is more than enough.

Bring on the poker!
